result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adriano Lasica

records.addlTxt: Motion to Suppress Evidence, filed by defense

Defendant Adriano Lasica in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adriano Lasica appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense requested motion hearing date.  Defense motion to be filed on or before 09/30/2022. State's response, if appropriate, to be filed on or before 10/31/2022.  Defense reply, if appropriate, to be filed on or before 11/09/2022. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Adriano Lasica in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Discussion held.  Defense request addtional time to do an open records request for discovery.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised  this hearing will be streamed lived on Dacast -via zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Adriano Lasica in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of the State's Offer and Paper discovey and waiting for digital discovery. State will follow up. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Warrant authorized on May 9, 2022 not issued.  Defendant was previously booked.  Warrant rejected.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Adriano Lasica not in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER.  Defendant was ordered to be booked on May 6, by 5 pm.  Defendant failed to do so.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Adriano Lasica in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/04/2022@01:30pm
